result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha Jean Gillis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samantha Jean Gillis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samantha Jean Gillis was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Refund balance of bond to payor.

Court dismisses Counts 2, 3 and 4 with prejudice.
If Defendant is successful with treatment the Court will dismiss without prejudice.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha Jean Gillis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus   DF:  Samantha Jean Gillis appeared. Case called at 3:34. Includes 16CM197, 16CM243, 16CM143. ADA Nieskes updates the court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 in 16CM143. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 16CM143. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses without prejudice 16CM197 and 16CM243 and dismiss with prejudice Ct. 2, 3 and 4 in 16CM143. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
- 2 days St. Croix County jail
  Credit for time served 
-  $500.00 inclusive of costs. 
    Apply bond on file. Return the remainder to payor. 

If DE is successful with treatment the court will dismiss without prejudice.  Review scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 07:45 am.
Filed by J. Radenbaugh. Re: work policy for Def. Reviewed by SRN. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus DF: Samantha Jean Gillis appeared. Case called at 8:02. Includes 16CM143, 16CM197, 16CM243. ADA Nieskes updates the court. DE has begun treatment and request a date towards the end of June. Atty. Firkus agrees. Address confirmed. Bonds continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 5, 2016 at 08:00 am.

16CM197, 16CM143 and 16CM243 
*AMENDED*

Per Judge Needham on 4/25/16 Defendant may provide sample in an unobserved, private location before release. 

Report every  Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

**AMENDED**

16CM197, 16CM143

Report every  Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
Pre-trial conference on May 5, 2016 at 08:00 am.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus,  DF:  Samantha Jean Gillis appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address. Defendant does qualify for PD.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  ADA Nieskes is requesting a $250.00 CB, Atty Firkus argues. Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
